title: Dorchester man charged in Jamaica Plain crash that seriously injured pedestrian
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Crime Michael Owens was charged on Wednesday after allegedly hitting and severely injuring a pedestrian in June.
A Dorchester man was charged on Wednesday after he allegedly hit and severely injured a pedestrian back in June, according to a statement from Suffolk District County Attorney Kevin Hayden’s office.

Michael Owens, 53, was arraigned in the West Roxbury Division of Boston Municipal Court on charges of negligent operation of a vehicle, assault and battery with a dangerous weapon causing serious bodily injury, and serious and negligent operation of a vehicle while under the influence of alcohol, according to the statement.

title: Bruins sign Alex Steeves to two-year contract extension
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins With Steeves signed, only one forward on Boston's roster isn't signed through the 2026-27 season.
Alex Steeves has carved out a role as a versatile forward for Boston this season.

title: Officials investigating after dead sea ducks found dumped at N.H. welcome center
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Police are investigating a potential Wanton Waste Law violation.
New Hampshire Fish and Game Law Enforcement Division ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Eleven dead sea ducks were found at a New Hampshire welcome center earlier this month, the New Hampshire Fish and Game Law Enforcement Division reported.

title: Trillium’s Greenway beer garden won’t return this summer after nearly a decade
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Food News The popular seasonal spot has poured beers along the Greenway since 2017, but a new tenant will take over the space this year.
Derek Swart enjoys a Little Chicken pale ale while visiting Trillium Garden on The Greenway in June of 2017.
Craig F.

title: Weather-related issues cause delays for some MBTA Commuter Rail riders
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Transportation On the bright side, the commuter rail is at least past its “slippery rail” season.

Dina Rudick / The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin January 21, 2026 | 4:25 PM 1 minute to read Cold, icy weather has caused repeated headaches for some commuter rail riders this week, with the MBTA’s Fitchburg Line seeing delays two mornings in a row.

Tuesday’s rush hour delays stemmed from an issue with train crossings, and a spokesperson for Keolis — which operates the commuter rail — explained that road salt and cyclical freezing and thawing can cause the gates to get stuck down in “safe mode.

title: Stefon Diggs salutes Cardi B’s support during first season with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "She wasn’t a football girl before I converted her over.
